pros: Can teach your class without interference from the administration. There are a lot of full time opportunities that Hocking will give people an opportunity to do.
cons: I actually really like it here.

pros: Pros: it’s very convenient to have on an on campus job!
cons: Hocking Colleges own website suggest the majority of houses and or apartments/townhouses are more cost effective than using the colleges dorms. This at the base rate of $10.00 means every week of max 16 hours… you barely have enough money for rent at the cheapest place in Nelsonville. Not to mention buying groceries, school supplies, gas and general life expenditures. Hocking is a daily reminder of the life that used to be in Nelsonville and the college before Young arrived. Hocking’s campus is empty and void of student life or activities. I have never in my life seen/heard of such a boring lifeless campus. Hocking college does “Community day” events but they are the same activities led over and over. Hocking College doesn’t care about its staff, students or the community. Hocking college has knowingly let students enter dangerous situations because of poor management leadership. After reporting these issues multiple times and personally complained nothing was done and I was brushed off. Nothing very happened to the mangers that knowingly break the law everyday at this college. I have never regretted a decision more in my life than to attend hocking as my mother and father did before me!

pros: Helpful, supportive, knowledgeable program director
cons: Class size of 40 makes meaningful feedback difficult.

job_title: Adjunct Nursing Instructor in Nelsonville, OH
pros: The Dean and Associate Dean are doing great things for the nursing program. They are really making it what it used to be.
cons: Pay. Full time faculty deserve better pay.

pros: Normal work not that bad
cons: Good environment and people are friendly

pros: Small student population Small teacher student ratio
cons: Low pay Lack of professional development

pros: There are good people working there and they do have a generous vacation policy.
cons:
This school needs to be investigated by the Ohio Department of Education. They are overcharging students for services that are never rendered in course fees and the students do not know any better.

Moreover there are serious allegations against the top management including allegations of sexual assault by the Chief of Staff.

All employees there are generally upset but too scared to say anything out of fear.

The President does not care about the students nor is she ever there on campus. She is using this job for her personal gain and has surrounded herself with her friends in order to stay in power.

I have never seen anything like this at any college or university anywhere else and am in shock that is still in operation.

pros: -State retirement benefits -Christmas break
cons: - The organization/classes are in a cascading state of chaos due to constant staff turnover -Union busting practices have resulted in little to no qualified teaching staff - Mandatory 1 hour lunch and meetings regularly scheduled after 5 pm result in a 45+ hour work week - No flexibility in scheduling or work from home options

pros: Good area to live, rural.
cons: Mostly adjunct instructors hired. Top heavy administration.

pros: The original mission of this college was a good one (to provide education and good paying jobs for students coming from areas of economic stress). When I first started working here, this was the emphasis and it felt good to help lift up the community through its students.
cons: The existing administration has lost sight of the original mission. Very few employees (at all levels) last more than 2 years. Extremely poor communication, decisions made without research, misuse of funds, and general mistreatment of staff has resulted in a lack of stability and low enrollment (no job security).

review_title: Was once a great place to work sadly those days are gone
pros: Unfortunately there are non.. the President of the College hires personal friends for important positions that are not clearly not qualified
cons: The President and Vice Presidents genuinely do NOT care about their employees. All have an elitist mentality despite claiming to come from poverty. Extremely out of touch.

pros:
its a small college in the Hocking Hills region of SE Ohio, mostly certificates and associate degrees. 

there are great people that work there, that care and try but they are usually being held back & prevented from progress in the right direction from supervisors. have to keep a low profile, and follow the herd in order to avoid negative attention
cons:
its certainly not a revelation to learn Hocking suffers from a negative workplace culture thats more about "im gonna get mine" and "dont stand in my way" - and unfortunately, its from the top down. I knew staff members that had been working there for 5-8 years, never given a promotion or raise. In fact, your more likely to get demoted & a pay cut (while top dogs get bonuses for reducing. costs). Its a crying shame all professors are being replaced by adjuncts because its not like the teachers interfacing w students is a critical part of what makes a college great, adjuncts are replaceable, unimportant and most of all cheap. its a small old boys club over there, anything needing approval in the city of nelsonville - the city council & college's trustees are essentially the same group meeting in a different room.

unfortunately, this reputation was formed prior to current administrators. Rather than ushering in positive change, new administration seems to have settled nicely into a dictator-like position in which loyalty is awarded not good work or honest conversation, and if you dont want to break into that self-serving circle, your time at Hocking will be limited. Dont worry tho, youll leave & realize just how bad you were being treated & thankful for getting out.

pros: Helping students who need our help
cons: Poorly managed, inner circles, toxic work environment, extraordinarily high employee turnover, a lot of drama

pros: Great people with lots of heart work there, trying their best.
cons: Micromanagement from the top, staff unable to perform their jobs with harassment and belittling. I do not forsee things improving for staff until upper management changes.

pros: If you're right out of college and desperate for a job Hocking College is an easy place to find a job at because so many people quit year after year.
cons: If your idea of getting ahead in the workplace involves kissing loads of butt then Hocking College is the place for you. The president is a cruel vicious dictator with tunnel vision. She can only agree with one opinion-HERS! She surrounds herself with "yes people" who look the other way when she makes bad decisions. If the school had a new president it might become a decent place to work. And if you want to work in Marketing there you better stock up on some tight short skirts-if you catch my drift.

pros: There are absolutely no pros for this place. It is an ongoing disaster unfolding with no accountability in sight.
cons: The problems start at the President's office and stay there. People want to care and do well only to be destroyed by micromanaged and intrusive bullying tactics of leadership.

pros: No pros applicable besides you got paid on timw
cons: I was underpaid and over worked

pros: Provides professional development opportunities for growth. Open to new ideas.
cons: The workflow process sometimes becomes bottlenecked.

cons: Hocking River, Flooded plains, Hocking Heights

pros: Money is not that bad
cons:
It's falling apart.
There are hardly any students.
There's layer upon layer of red tape and you can't get anything done.

pros: The President does a terrific job leading her staff and the people of the college. You get plenty of time off, and a state retirement.
cons: The reviews on here aren’t the greatest. But I love working at Hocking.

pros: Paid time off and downtime
cons: Management and constantly changing of policies

review_title: Love this place,  got us through Covid, bright future.

pros: There are no pros to this job.
cons: Administration uses abuse, fear and micromanagement to crush the employees to miserable depths. School has great students and caring employees.

pros: Working to help students, many of whom come from challenging backgrounds.
cons: Leadership was very self oriented.  There was a lot of blame gaming to avoid any feedback from staff.  It was a very stifling atmosphere.  Many of the good people that worked there have all moved on.

pros: Great pay and benefits. 21 hours/week for 30 weeks/year.
cons: Administration and management didn't know how to administer and manage.

pros: Great colleagues and wonderful students
